intro: Taxanthema tetragonum, commonly known as the four-cornered taxanthema, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Taxanthema tetragonum is known for its ability to survive in harsh conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
